70ZuBKUxyvkHhxFieHMwAQ.text: Lupie's is awesome been here for a long time like since the 80s and before . I miss the big servings of chili Mac they have down-sided their plate size and serving size. It's 2018 I would totally pay more for a larger portion. I miss saying good God that's a lot of food and taking half home with me . Place is awesome not dissing at all just miss the portion sizes. I would totally pay more for the good old days   . Peach Kuchen a must and the meat loaf and chicken n dumplings forget about it , delish. I have a lot of happy memories from this place.

0rizS1lzYoKm4xHXs8jA5A.text: I have ordered through Doordash twice. My 1st experience was pretty good. I had ordered the chilli burger and potato salad. The next order was a vegetable plate and it was delicious. Which consisted of pintos, potato salad, and mac and cheese. Finally, I tried the Texas Chili and it was awful. It had way too much diced onions and I had remove one tablespoon full and included a triangular slice of cornbread. When my previous orders had a regular square shape cornbread. The mac and cheese was good but all items was cold. Only thing I enjoyed the most was the sweet tea. I will no longer order through Doordash from here. I had plans on dining in, forget it. Very disappointed... Bet there's a shortage of onions today.

mBSbxEwgCZ36ZKbPdEAKag.text: I WANT to love this place. But no matter how hard I try nor how many times I go hoping I just got the wrong thing last time I just don't. I love the idea of it and the staff is great, the food...not so much.  I've tried the burger, different kinds of chilis, salads, meatloaf, chicken n dumplings, various sides and Mac n cheese. The best being the meatloaf and the worst being a tie between the chicken n dumplings and the Mac n cheese. Unfortunately ordered in one trip. I don't understand how some of the reviewers find this to be the best Mac n cheese in charlotte. It tasted like off cheese and that was the only flavor it possessed. The chicken n dumplings were ridiculously thick with little sign of chicken and way too many pastey unappetizing dumplings.   Stick to the meatloaf which I think is only available on Mondays ( don't quote me on that) and the green beans and you might leave happy. I will probably be back since it's somewhere that my parents like to go. Perhaps then I will see what all the fuss is about.   Am I missing something?!

y4jKuw1DOSoTd7whOzUgmA.text: There are two restaurants in Charlotte that feed both the body and the soul - Lupie's is one of those places.  Known for their four styles of chili, it's probably their main draw. I prefer their coarse chilis - Texas or Southern style. I keep mine basic - no toppings. I pair it with whatever daily side they have going that day and a piece of cornbread.  But Lupie's ringers are their daily specials and ever-changing daily sides. Friday is roasted pork day. Get it. Just trust me.  The place is definitely laid back and casual and the building isn't fancy, so check any haughtiness at the door. Actually, if you're haughty, don't bother coming because you don't deserve Lupie's awesomeness.

sPnDzGLURl1tmhmoNKcWHg.text: Sorry Lupie's.....Chili had no taste....it was truly a cup 'o ground beef....the place needs a good cleaning....felt very dirty!  I guess you can go just to say you been there, but I wouldn't go back a second time.

Ij6AulBEf9JFRJnLFeecoA.text: Used to be a mainstay and I've neglected going there until tonight  Sad that things have changed. I hope that folks will rediscover Lupies soon  They were hip here before anything else was.

6ZSXAW19ipnS98L8tma7jg.text: Back from the total eclipse in SC and had to have some great Texas chili. Tried the chili mac (mac and cheese) with jalapenos and it was excellent. Plus awesome service. I think their chili would be good in a burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lupie&#39;s Chili mac (mac and cheese) and great corn bread

V5mpPxzP_zlhCxIJEpEt9w.text: Been eating at Lupies for over 20 years. Food is always consistently good! It's a neat dive. Their Texas chili is awesome and always perfect for a burger or nachos. The chili slaw burger or nachos are the best. Sweet tea is always perfectly sweetened.

y0vVLTDS3Jp0QH1-xKpSIQ.text: It took me a few years to discover this restaurant since they look a little sketchy from the outside. A coworker dragged me into Lupie's 3 years ago and I have been a fan ever since. The only negative to this restaurant is that they are closed on Sundays.  Just like with Chick Fil A, I always end up wanting Lupie's on Sundays when I am working weekends.    I have had their burgers and their nachos and both are to die for.  If you eat normal sized portions, you may want to share the nachos with a friend because they are enormous.  I have never finished even half of my plate of nachos!   The service is speedy and the staff are always friendly.  Parking can be a little touch and go if you come during a busy time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

p2I70ypAAOV08nyRmql9QQ.text: Fast service, inexpensive good. My favorite is spaghetti nights!  I absolutely LOVE the spaghetti. Big helpings and plenty of sides!!  The sweet tea is also to die for. You won't walk away hungry...unless you get the chili.  I got the Cincinnati and it was horrible! No flavor, I couldn't even finish it after 2 bites. The cornbread was hard as a rock (twice) and flavorless.

U5cvEx_nAMHm-LIHUI7QDg.text: What can I say about this iconic Charlotte restaurant. I've been coming here for 27 years. The menu had been expanded. The chicken and dumplings are excellent. The mac and cheese is to die for. I also recommend the nachos. Real southern home cooking. The owner has passed management over to her daughter. This is a must visit for anyone in Charlotte.

Z5LdIaxSmVhwNU37-7mtoQ.text: This little hole in the wall is like a diamond in the rough!  I'm very thankful to have been introduced to this Charlotte legacy.  With daily specials and down-home southern hospitality, it's a win all the way around.  Everything is homemade "just like Grandma used to make it!"  My goto comfort foods are the mac-n-cheese and the chicken and dumplings.  They're oh so good, but a word to the wise:  the dumplings aren't available everyday.  Based on the specials calendar, you can expect to get you a good helping on Thursdays.  Sometimes they will serve them up as a part of their Saturday rotation, but there are no guarantees.  I've also tried the chili, banana pudding, eclair pie (which is more like eclair pudding), quiche, green beans, etc.  I've yet to be disappointed.  This isn't your high-class, white tablecloth type of establishment, so lower your expectations.  Keep it casual and go for the food.  If you're looking for glitz and glam, keep on keepin' on.

L9uws5y89Fpx7V9ujByF5A.text: If you're craving some food that'll warm your soul, I can't stress enough how much you should check out Lupie's. The veggie plate is a safe bet -- they have regular sides and then a few special sides that change each day. The chili is fantastic, and I believe what they're best known for -- my boyfriend picked the Cincinnati chili and our server brought him a sample to make sure he was happy with his choice. Love that. As a side note, the banana pudding is some of the best I've had in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie plate with broccoli casserole, green beans, macaroni and cheese, and salad. In the back is Texas chili with mac and cheese.

nV_FgqaFf5xC3--jP4kY0Q.text: Wow. Great food and fast service. This place was a find for me and my wife grabbing a bite before a concert at the nearby auditorium. This could easily be the destination instead of the side trip. Nice sized portions and a very attentive staff makes this place a big hit.

m2wmeQ_up6JsnpVklun57A.text: I talked about this place to the husband for several months and yet we never made our way over here...until this past weekend!  I was so excited to show him this fun little dive full of yummy chili, burgers, hotdogs and other southern soul food items.   He loves places like this so I was hopeful that this would be his new spot!   I am sad to report that we both left pretty disappointed.  Maybe I hyped it up too much.  I mean it has been about 15 years since I was last there but wow...  We stuck with the basics....I ordered the Cincinatti chili and it was just not good.  Weird taste, no beans (although it says they are in there) and chopped up meat...like really chopped up.  The raw onions and sprinkle of cheddar cheese were my favorite parts.  The cornbread was drier than my grandma's skin.  Tasteless.  I couldn't even use it to dip in the chili because it was like a plastic, crumbly mess.  Husband ordered the chili dog and he was underwhelmed.  The greasy chips that came on the side were okay I guess??  Service was okay--they seem to try to hard to have that "we're a cool dive in Charlotte" vibe but it was okay.  Plus they recently opened one in Huntersville so that automatically takes away from the novelty of the place.  Eh--wouldn't feel compelled to come back but I'm sure there are other things on the menu that would make it worth the trip for others.  Price is right too.

8Ttu8-dnkvDKYnEDi4JFRA.text: Loaded Texas nachos are the best in town.  This place is one of the best dives in the QC.  $1 PBRs everyday.  Can't lose.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

hvcQ-pJarV2u4dzbQx7ahA.text: Their Cinncinnati Style Chili is the Bomb ! I like mine with with Onions and Cheddar Cheese. I can also vouch for the Nachos (Best in Charlotte). My Wife always goes Nuts over the Vegetable Soup and Quiche. If you haven't been to Lupie's you are really missing out. Fresh homemade food in generous portions, and a friendy staff make this one of my favorite places in Charlotte.

X2d_AFd_MJIHuxbgjdmq4A.text: It was okay here,  definitely not bad.  I had the quiche and it was very good.  I didn't find the portions to be as large as the others say.  The atmosphere is cool.

hJ0rBQJ9eUKV6D6oz0re-Q.text: A Charlotte icon!  In 15 years, I have never had a bad meal there.  The Texas Chili is GREAT!  Go there at lunch for a great meal, surrounded by local hospital and button-downed types.  The go back for dinner to enjoy dining with the "eclectic" side of Charlotte.

snd5WHG7rRGnipOaran06g.text: I always hear rave reviews about the chili at Lupie's, but I just wasn't all that impressed. (By comparison, I went to the annual Plaza Midwood/Chantilly Chili Cookoff and found WAY BETTER chili of all varieties.) Still, Lupie's is one of those landmark restaurants in Charlotte - and one of few that's still standing - so I want to support it. I'd recommend checking it out. It's a little off the beaten path and it's a fun down-home kind of place.

PXXTsKjH63gXN0r41gF2LQ.text: Lupie's is fantastic.  The food is cheap, huge, and delicious.  They offer a daily special everyday that comes with 2 sides and sweet tea (usually about 5 or 6 dollars) and they also have a variety of sandwiches.  The best bet in my opinion is the veggie plate, which comes with cornbread and tea (only $4.85 for 4 veggies).  Don't miss the mac and cheese or the sweet tea, and for those of you that like blue cheese dressing- this is some of the best in town.  This place is decent sized and has a quick turn-over, but if you go during the lunch or dinner rush you might have to wait a little bit.

iaukOijahOgBpH4nheaXlg.text: The Lupies in Huntersville is a 5-star burger joint. The one on central is a 3. Their burgers weren't as good as I've had in Huntersville and the building is a bit run down.  I know a lot of people that love this place, but I guess i'm just not a fan of seeing dust and spiderwebs everywhere.

B52XT3cC87KhCgE9zcZ_Iw.text: Great chicken and dumplings on thursdays, delicious sweet tea all the time and some of the best comfort food in Charlotte. A fun atmosphere with great food all around.

edmWfIhUSgGx4SBH9a81OQ.text: I agree with other reviewers -- you have to train for a meal at Lupie's like you would if you were entering the Nathan's hot dogs competition. You're gonna get a lot of crazy good food for just a tiny bit of money. Don't bring neat-freak friends here. The food, like the place, is gloriously sloppy. Mercifully, there's an endless supply of napkins on the table.

LZ8cRe_zgBSybZY7IevSpw.text: This place is always good, friendly, and on point. Those things seem hard for other restaurants to do, so I love Lupies.

ibsAicNvgGsF0fIWhi3TIA.text: i love this place!. whenever i have guest out of town , i bring them there. also good for date nights. i love the laid back atmosphere, home cooking and the prices are the best. the kitshy design is  alwawys cool.the staff is friendly and attentive. i think they have the best sweet tea i ever tasted!

I6j8mWWjrIbnfWfNlgds9Q.text: While it is all good at Lupie's, we especially like the veggie plate.  The three- or four-veggie plate is always high quality and very filling; esp. love the macaronii and cheese, beans, pintos and onions, carrots, and slaw.  Comes with delicious cornbread.  The quiche is exceptional too.  Prices and service always good.  NOT FANCY...get over it.  We drive 90 miles several times a year, in large part to have lunch here.  Lupie keeps a close eye on the place...she's there all the time, which is why it is consistently good.

8YQma96SAN1pnxU8XD13-Q.text: HUGE burgers with spicy chili, nachos, and dollar beers.  Need I say more?

ZUAKNefCN_UnZBI83BpKeg.text: I first started going to Lupie's in 1997 when I was in college.  I'd totally give this place a 5 stars, but not everyone will necessarily be a fan of the place and its still, so 4 is sufficient.  I absolutely love getting the veggie plate.  SO many options and in the summer even more!  I also have to get the Throw Down Nachos with vegetarian chili every once in a while.  Not for those on a diet, but every so many months the splurge is worth the wait!  Must order them in because they don't heat them as a to-go order; don't want the chips to go soggy.  They are very, very simple, but TERRIFIC!  My favorite special day is Thursday because the chicken-n-dumplings are about the best you can get outside of grandma's house (but MUCH better than anyone in my family and I'm from rural NC!).  I wouldn't go with a group over 6 because the seating will be iffy, but go!  My husband almost always gets the barbeque sandwich on a kaiser roll with mac-n-cheese.  He thinks its the bomb!  They have 4 different types of chili now-so try one.

gcXiy8vWhpNAulJXAfTVsw.text: I like Lupie's - it is not high on the "healthy quotient", but if you must deviate - there's no better place to do so. The bottomless nachos (took me 3 days to eat those) are great, good burgers. Let's just say if your watching any of those tricky health issues - cholesterol, weight, blood pressure - stay away. However, when you know you want to eat good, relatively inexpensive and alot - go to Lupie's!

UcOSmNHRJlI5HPRAeaZd0A.text: I absolutely love this east Charlotte staple. Food is always reasonably priced. They have amazing chili. Service is awesome. They remember your name.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Texas chili with Spaghetti! If you love spicy than this dish has your name all over it. Less than $10.

xbAMKv1Azt6Fyqrqt952Mw.text: Chicken and dumplings chicken and dumplings chicken and dumplings.   Did I say chicken and dumplings?   Get my point?  Oh, add some cornbread and some broccoli casserole.  Yes, a winter's day of comfort food never hurt anyone, including me.  Lupie's has been in Charlotte for over 30 years.  It is kitschy. It is funkily cozy. It is unique.  Be careful if you don't like fatback in your veggies.  They put it in almost everything.   The music they played included so many of my favorite songs.  What a fun experience and I would recommend this when you want a plate full of feel good food and an atmosphere that has hippy written all over it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

2crOR8LAnahjWFZPayvEPg.text: Great little dive, glad I saw it on the side of the street when I was heading to the hotel. The burger was awesome, just what I needed, and prices are great here. I come to Charlotte for work once a month and will definitely be making this a regular spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

u-lXPjk0S5-1RskFsCZfYg.text: A couple of friends and I came here before a hockey game and I was very happy we did.   The prices are reasonable and my food was really good. 12 wings for 8 dollars. My friend got the nachos which were really good too.

2lH_KE_EQ9kyzKIH4wBqeg.text: I was really excited to try Lupie's cafe on a cold, clear day last week, but I wasn't as impressed as other reviews led me to believe.  Since I'd heard so much about their famous chili, I instantly went for the vegetarian option. The waiter then easily convinced me to try it over mac n cheese. The chili was good, the mac n cheese was okay (I think I'll just take them separate from now on). The cornbread was really dry which ruined it a bit for me.  The fella ordered the chicken sandwich with coleslaw. He said the chicken was really tough, and he didn't clean his plate which tells me more than his words do.   Overall, it's a decent meal for a decent price, but the food quality wasn't as high as hoped.

XNqW1RoMkRHXY3_1i7uxxg.text: Best restaurant in Charlotte. Great prices, great food, great atmosphere. Love the LGBT-inclusive environment. You've got to come here on Thursdays for the chicken and dumplings. Any other day, try the southern chili throwdown nachos. Great for sharing -- and P.S., ask for a half serving if it's just one or two people. And of course, salsa and jalapenos. There's no fryer, so don't expect French fries -- but the green beans and baked mac and cheese are amazing!! And lastly... the sweet tea is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Specials
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu Back
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu Front

Jqq8xC64i8P6eEJPZQp36A.text: This was my first time visiting...and probably my last. The meal was okay and the waitress was nice. What did it for me was the unnecessarily rude guy who checked us out. He clearly needs to learn the basics of customer service. I asked for a to-go cup of ranch dressing to go with my wings. He was very short and stated that I needed to pay $.80 for it because "it's not free". That is not how you talk to people.

rC4dfKxhjXKga7yvYZQmMQ.text: The food was really good. Real clean restaurant good atmosphere. Service real good. Really enjoyed myself.

BDG2cZHX5kiE-sYVd32Fjg.text: Do yourself a flavor and hit this spot up. The chili is the best in town. I do half Texas half Cincinnati and it is incredible. No frills place but that's part of the charm. Staff is awesome also, quick and will chat with you for a bit. My friend Matt loves the chili burger but I can't stray for my normal order, because I am a creature of habit.

sDhlAhadInmbv0JN3xPfKA.text: 5 stars because this place is unique in its own way. The daily specials are made with love, and my son says the burgers really bring the flavor!! I would agree.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

CuEZYO5vDqicQNyoKoXpHg.text: The place is a little eclectic "hole in the wall" styled joint. The staff is so friendly. Great comfort food that is very affordable. The staff here made my day today - people make the difference. I will be back and soon!

p5e6HbnNliVztMpR8wLB3g.text: Oh my gosh... ordered the cucumbers and onion as a three veggie plate as an appatizer and it was amazing...   Then we got a huge plate of nachos. More than enough for 2 people. We are stuffed, and have leftovers!!! Love this place. We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huge nachos!!!!!
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cucumbers and onion.   So good!!

H5kSGiOaoqWCsig3Ix4klw.text: Mmmmm.   I've been wanting to go here for a while. The place is kind of divey but it has great character. We were greeted immediately and they told us that we can sit wherever we want in the downstairs area. All the servers were super nice. Their sweet tea is awesome. My husband loves their beer choices!  I asked if we can have a little chili sampler and she brought it out for us. My favorite was the texas chili and vegetarian chili. I love spicy food and these two chilis definitely had a kick to it. We started out with the buffalo wings. Their buffalo flavor was nothing like I've had before and it was delicious. It was flavorful and spicy with a pepper taste to it. Wings were huge and juicy and their ranch really compliments it.   I got the chili mac with spaghetti noodles. I had it with a mix of texas chili and vegetarian chili. There was a large portion of spaghetti noodles topped with the chili and cheese and onions. It was absolutely delicious. Perfect for a chilly night. We will definitely go back. I'm gonna try either the spaghetti or chicken and dumplings next time. They do daily specials so check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

688IN2_nRmt-DnO6o5cOLA.text: Love this place! Never had a bad meal here. They have different specials every night as well as "their usuals". The chicken casserole on Tuesday is excellent. Prices are really good and service is great. Highly recommend this place.

5bRGTm4vz98bIyxpFJAp1g.text: Best place for Chili in Charlotte - miss the old Huntersville location.  Great food, eclectic atmosphere and friendly staff.  I highly recommend the Throw Down Nachos all the way.  Tammy likes the veggie plate and the spaghetti.   Did I mention the $1 PBR.   Those with unlimited bank roll can drink craft beer for $5.   2nd favorite place to eat in Charlotte.   Mertz is #1.

qcaP_9tqzneZXp8SuO5E2Q.text: I've been to Lupies many times over the past 20+ years.  If this weren't a beloved dive restaurant it would have closed years ago.  My husband loves the chili, chicken and dumplings, and burgers.    However the  food comes mostly out of a can.  Today I had the daily quiche special, which was mostly melted cheese in a pie shell.   Salad was iceberg lettuce with some diced tomatoes, but also served with very nice orange and Apple slices. Service is very good, atmosphere divey, food is mediocre.

GPwPd09iIis8ayd5aG11KA.text: Do you like good nachos? Do you like Chili? Do you like quiche? How about meatloaf, chicken and dumplings, and banana pudding? This dive is an amazing place to eat if you are visiting Charlotte or if you are a local (if you live here, why haven't you been?. Writing this review makes me want to go back now! It isn't much to look at, but you'll love this dingy little hole-in-the-wall.

k6MMv_umBMIeLo_PxOGx5Q.text: You have to order their chili!  The hot one too!  It's delicious and on a cold day its perfect.  The building looks a little sketchy but awesome once you're in!

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Never can go wrong with a local seasonal.

Ta90SdqQ29RIbjSvl-fsfw.text: Great chili! I like the sweet one the best - Cincinnati. Great employees. Menu is full of tasty selections. Chili is always a must - also try the spicy Texas chili. Cool beer selections. Neat decor.   Great lunchtime and dinner specials.   Parking lot is a bit iffy.  Potholes and loose gravel.

kaVmKYMeXIFvHoFgBiSjlg.text: Love this place. Totally old-school-Charlotte vibes.  Love their simple, tried & True menu.  Their vegetarian chili is Awesome!!  Their burgers are amazing... solid choice for a meal.

jZ3Wen0MgEcNVM4v8w0rnQ.text: I'm not a big fan of Charlotte. For me it is a lonely, soulless city of finance, and as an effete intellectual from the 919 end of the state, I must be completely opposed.   But damn this is a good casual place. I was interning there a few summers ago and some Charlotte friends happened to be in town for a few days and they led me here. I had the Cincinnati chili all the way and it was tasty and kept me full the rest of the night. I was able to enjoy "Wedding Crashers" without worrying about an empty stomach.  Best of all, it was like $5. And there was a ton leftover. That made me wish I wasn't going to the movies afterward, as it would have made an excellent leftover meal the next day.

YilG3EVjUiuWbwzFGXd8zw.text: I would give Lupie's Cafe a solid three stars; 2 stars for unimpressive food and 4 stars for good service.  I'm pleased with my experience, but don't plan to return immediately.  For starters, the waitresses were sweet as pie (time to pull out the Southernisms) at this down-home, no-frills restaurant.  Our server was authentically friendly, making jokes about how the menu was conceived during the height of the Atkins diet craze-sandwiches without the buns and other no-carb nonsense.  During our meal, Another server made certain that we had drink refills as needed and offered dessert in case the server who took our order didn't.   The food was brought out promptly and covered the plate.  My first response was "Holy Mackerel" but soon turned to "Meh".  I ordered the barbecue plate with mac-n-cheese and green beans.  The portions were generous and I think the mac-n-cheese was the highlight of the meal.  The recipe was a knock-off of your granny's heartwarming (and artery-clogging) classic with a baked crust.  Mmmm. The barbeque was good but could have used more seasoning.  By BBQ, I mean Carolina-style minced pork minus the regional flavoring (mustard, vinegar, tomato).  The green beans were tasteless; actually they tasted like canned beans and the cornbread wasn't really worth my time.    I'm not entirely disappointed with Lupie's, but there was a lot to be desired.  The decor is funky and charmingly, the staff friendly, and food is approaching down-home goodness and flowing off the plate. I guess I need to give the touted chili or meatloaf a try.

ks9GHFatqFzE4efzYC9TyQ.text: Lupie's has a fantastic veggie burger, which pleases me. It's not as good as the one at the Penguin, but it's nice to find options for diner-style food that can serve vegetarians. I love the tea in the big mason jars.  The service is casual but friendly. I often had conversations with the servers about my tattoos and got the invitation to take a look at theirs, which always makes for good dinner conversation.  When I first lived in Charlotte, I lived off of 7th Street, so I spent a lot of time at Lupie's. Now that I've moved across town, I don't make it over there as much. I kind of miss it...the great-big plates of unpretentious food...I might have to go there tonight!

JoEkxyH1SLZoj5XQtGU4ig.text: Great place with affordable prices!  Little (eclectic) in decor but one of my favorite burger places in Charlotte.

98ox2nTzfLWGBk9MGWLmcg.text: The Texas Chili was absolutely delicious. It's not the prettiest place in the world, but I'd definitely go back for the awesome food!

iv9XG5hEfvodRrycLCcDYA.text: They also have a great BLT. I am picky about bacon. It must be extra crispy. Most places don't make it crispy enough. Lupie's does. I would go here all the time but there is a smoking section and smoke doesn't know how to keep out of my lungs once we're in the same building. So- as much as I enjoyed the food, atmosphere, music and servers... I won't be back anytime soon :(  PS They have a pretty good kids' menu. I would bring kids here except for the smoke. I still don't understand why we have laws that say you must be 18 to smoke, and we know second hand smoke is worse than first hand- but we'll let little kids breathe second hand smoke in restaurants all over town. Hmmmm...

uD5enyP3_sUGOy-okR3NWw.text: BEWARE...Way too many break-ins while you are inside enjoying the good food.  Don't go a night.  There are no security cameras!

dwxXvVpaDCK3Jaut-W_bXw.text: Chicken and Dumplings were fantastic...great feel.  Awesome place for lunch. Fast efficient service.

kpscLZHF17OEket3F9ahrQ.text: In my opinion this is another case of "less is more". All of the food here is made very well and they do not try to go over the top on any of the ingredients which seems to pay off more often than not. This restaurant has been voted best of many times in local publications and I hope that isn't a trend that declines as the years go by. If you haven't been, for sure go check it out. The chili is awesome and everything is reasonably priced.

uiDUnqEkGx_uA7rfqOxGLQ.text: Had a great lunch here.  Very kind and attentive service.  I had the pulled pork BBQ sandwich and it was terrific.  My friends had burgers and enjoyed them as well.  I didn't get to imbibe, but I saw that they had Shiner Bock on their beer list, which made me VERY happy.  I love places like this and, when you're on the road, the fact that the place is original, independent, and uses quality products-- it's enough to make me wanna cry.

93JLKzdOoqs94wWlmVVj8g.text: Decent food, good sizied portions. If you come here hungry more than likely you will come away full.  I always order the same thing the Texas Chilli Mac and its been good every time.

CJOE0ljgJKnNECnjcZxrZg.text: Oh god, I just.... I just love you, Lupie's.  There, I said it.  Now declare your reciprocated love for me by serving me delicious chili mac, burgers (meat & veggie alike), bbq plates, BEST mac n' cheese and veggies.  Confirm this love even further through your peach kuchen and banana pudding and I'm yours forever.  Serenade me with Parliament Funkadelic and the Smiths.  Thanks for making it okay to be lazy by driving to you instead of walking because I know I won't make it home when I'm done even though I live close by.

FGHn0Uv-9QCH__aSDM2KqQ.text: Quaint hole-in-the-wall restaurant.  I've only ever been for lunch, but the food is excellent and the service is lightning fast.  Thursday is Chicken and Dumpling day - out of this world!!

IB-qGdar23fjlnkE-4s9Dw.text: I have been eating there for 20 years. I love the food, the people, and Lupie! The nachos are amazing, and Monday night meatloaf and (real) mashed potatoes are a tradition and a passion.

MPQu80tvpoR6nhGqYxmM_w.text: I like this place, the atmosphere is cozy.  However there is something that I have ordered there that were so so. However the nachos are so ridiculously good that it will leave you drooling and full!  The small order can feed two.  PBR is only $1 here.

vuwkFkV_iD-EDyPk6rKJ8w.text: So had I left without dessert, I would have left 2 stars. For some reason I thought I needed banana pudding, so I ordered up some and my friend ordered the peach kuchen. OMG!!! Forget about the banana pudding, that freaking kuchen was the best dessert I have ever had! I would probably stab someone in the face for some more.. srsly, it's that good! The banana pudding was way too sweet for me, thankfully my friend was willing to share her kuchen! I think I will go back just for dessert! Everything else was just so-so for us. We both had the Monday meatloaf, but nothing to write home about. Now that kuchen... that's something!!

BZHemdfbSSgUolDaw4GXtg.text: Famous for their chili...I find the Cincinnati too nutmegy & the Texas too spicy. Get the daily special, chicken & dumplings or the burger. Great place great people.

0fZtpr3qzd568xc-onLQyg.text: I've heard some good things about this place, but not sure what all the hype is about. I went here for lunch today & got the special - spaghetti with corn & green beans on the side. The spaghetti was mediocre at best, very bland & unexciting with watery meat sauce (I think I could make it better and I've never made it) The sides were canned (not always an issue) but they were flavorless. Whoever posted about this place having fresh food is lying. I guess the atmosphere is attractive to some but I'm not a fan of restaurants that don't dust or clean. Sanitation rating 90.5 - not impressive. The place was packed, I guess this is the cool spot where all the "hip" people come. I just want good, quality food & to even begin to call this "Southern" food is a disgrace to my culture. My friend got the Southern chili & said it was the consistency of a Hormel chili, not great, not horrible. The cornbread he got was hard as a rock and was left uneaten after the first bite on the plate. The service was friendly & quick, that's about the only positive I experienced. I won't be rushing back to Lupies but since it is down the street from me I may try it again & see if it can get more than a 2 star rating. Keep in mind, I'm not a food snob but I know good food when I eat it & this was far from good...

6jcGNKfzJ9V_NZYjIL4b2Q.text: This is a local favorite that I had neglected to experience until recently.  I went on a weeknight with a large group of friends and left satisfied.  I ordered the nachos with hot chili (they offer 3 kinds of chili).  As a fan of spicy food, I wasn't disappointed.  The portion was monstrous!  There were about 9 of us altogether and though we did our best, we just couldn't conquer the nacho mountain!  The service was great, the music was great... all in all a fun trip.  I'll definitely go back!  My only complaint is with the small, pothole-stricken gravel parking lot.  I guess it kind of goes with the "hole-in-the-wall" theme.

57g1jQmOz39gPdN40KG2mQ.text: It's best not to eat for days before you step into this establishment.  The food is great and the portions are huge! I have never been able to finish a meal here.  The daily specials are always Meatloaf & Mashed Potatoes Monday, Fettucini Alfredo Tuesday, Spaghetti Wednesday, Chicken & Dumplin' Thursday, Spaghetti Friday...I must say that Mondays are my favorite, but the rest of the week is fine by me, too.  The mac & cheese is super yummy and I ALWAYS order this as a side.  Gosh, I miss you since I moved from Charlotte!!! :-(

Gkz7wtzJSVePDpV9EpHq8w.text: Lupies is a hidden gem in Charlotte near Plaza Midwood and Elizabeth on 7th st. Real good diner food with a cool vintage diner atmosphere. This ain't a fancy place but everything is awesome! Especially the chili! I get chili in a bowl, over nachos, over spaghetti - any way they'll let me! Get a cheap PBR and chill. Oh and don't forget to take a selfie with the awesome mural outside!

zgiyNE-A0y2c4zFun0Rm-A.text: Always stop in even when 1 to 1.5 hours out of my way   Was great Cincinnati chili. I'm not sure what has changed. It was so bitter. I'm from Cincinnati. I know this chili. I lived in Charlotte 3 years. I know Lupie's.   This was crap. Cornbread hard.  Margarine not butter.   Main thing this past weekend chili was tasting like cat food. Bitter cat food.   Will never return after 20 years of returns.

lhCKZUvJO7pqLansi8YiEg.text: short day at work due to a minor catastrophe so we wound up here while sorting through the rubble; cool and dark but not too dark with a nice blend of 70s and 80s power ballads and sing-alongs filling the empty room downstairs (the whole place was nearly full up a half hour later.) sat at the bar, draft lines still inoperative from some other malfunction but bottles and cans are available for the duration. after some idle banter and a couple tastes of chili (southern needs help from the green sauce) I'm nursing a cider waiting for the house's Texas Chili plus noodles, beans, onions, cheese, and a side of hotdog...  I was pleased by the portion size when it arrived: a generous serving of chili-enhanced spaghettis plus a 3x3 square of cornbreads accompanied by a very respectable sausage on a split roll slathered in chili with a tangy pickle spear along side for kicks. Alas, today's cornbread was forgettable, bland and without corny bits but otherwise still fit for consumption... could be a fan of the chilimac though: bunch of long, fat noodles add some substance to the bowl, beans and onions give some depth to the chili helping to accommodate a blast of the red that heats it all up nicely.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. sips of two chilis
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. aforementioned container
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. chilimac + a side of chilidog = to go container

pHI7tdEs2jKgN7iIeqI06g.text: Yet another visit to Lupie's, my longest running favorite dive in town!  I just can't help but ordering the same thing each and every time...Chili Mac with Texas Chili (minus Onions & Beans, plus extra Cheese), Corn on the side, and "Kuchen". Am seriously addicted to them all...and as usual, they were perfectly satisfying! Still, I have yet to find a better Chili Mac anywhere else in the U.S. BTW, although he won't admit it, my hubby is addicted to their Nachos with Texas Chili.   Once again, am stopping from giving all 5 stars because of the horrific overhead music. Like I mentioned in my previous review, the music here is quite inconsistent...some times better than other times, and the genre is always random. Tonight, however, it was the worst. Have no clue WHAT it was they were playing?? Not only bad, but the music was downright irritating. I can only hope they can improve the overhead selection in the future?  All that said, nothing can keep me from coming back for more of that Chili Mac...and Corn...and "Kuchen"! All just HEAVENLY. Like I told my hubby tonight, this has to be the biggest dive that I actually love! I do wonder what their sanitation grade may be...Anyone know? Well, don't think even a low score may prevent me from returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Kuchen&#34; (Thanks for the generous portion!)
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. One Layer Nachos
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili Mac, Corn

gvSZhuhMcV7BmMtbs02How.text: This has been on my list for quite some time so when we got back late on New Year's from holiday travels and didn't have time to go grocery shopping for the week, we decided to try this for dinner the next night.   Since they're known for their chili, we had to get it. They have 4 different kinds: Cincinnati, Texas, Vegetarian, and Southern. I really wanted to try them all in some kind of chili flight but there was no option for that.   We decided to try 3: Cincinnati with spaghetti, Texas with mac and cheese, and a cup of Southern. Both of us agreed that the Texas was by far the best, followed by the Cincinnati, and we did not like the Southern. The Texas was spicy and delicious with great flavor. It went great with the mac and cheese. My husband loves Skyline chili (from Cincinnati). We knew it wouldn't be the same, but judging it on it's own instead of comparing, it didn't quite do it for me. It was lacking a bit of flavor. I couldn't put my finger on what I didn't like about the Southern, but there was some flavor that neither of us liked at all.   All of them came with cornbread. I don't need my cornbread to be sweet, but this cornbread was very dry and lacking flavor.   You get a ton of food for the price. We mostly didn't eat the cup of chili we got since we didn't like it and both left stuffed.   It's a table service restaurant, but it's incredibly fast. They took our order and had our food out in less than 10 minutes. Once you're done eating you pay at the register.   I will say on the service side, our waiter was not very helpful with recommendations. We were trying to ask for recommendations on chili types and what would go best together and he didn't give us any help.   All in all, the food was cheap, fast, and some of it was quite tasty. I would come back again for the Texas chili but probably not anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cincinnati chili with spaghetti
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cup of southern chili
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Texas chili with mac and cheese

hOetzN8HAeHgi231B83rEQ.text: I try so hard to like these southern diner type of places and they always come up short. This particular visit was awful! We ordered nachos, burger, chili, and a side of steamed carrots. The burger was OK, but the rest was barely edible. The chili had a huge layer of grease on the top, the cornbread was rock hard, and the nachos looked like they'd been microwaved with a bean spread and cheese. I will never go back.

FqzsijZzsiExZ9bwjBpVxA.text: My favorite thing about this place is it's proximity to my house, but the food is also so good and a good deal.  I'll go over for lunch for some takeout and they are quick to fulfill the order, and it's usually pretty busy for lunch.   Love the variety of chili's to try, and also the variety of ways to try them - on top of spaghetti, macaroni and cheese, etc.  just a bowl is perfect enough for me, and is served to your liking with toppings and corn bread.   For the nine chili eaters, they also have a variety of other things to try as well.  But I definitely recommend you try a chili!

TqSLwpBp0xHeL0RRsWpVYA.text: First meal at Lupie's but I'll be back.  Loved my Cincinnati chili over spaghetti.  Good flavor.  Great ambiance.  Sadly dry cornbread but didn't really need the cornbread.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bar at Lupie&#39;s
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cincinnati Chili over Spaghetti

cTazB35ph7dAbmQczbtnlw.text: This used to be one of my favorite places given its veggie choices (includes banana pudding, of course) and it's nachos; however this trip the service was really poor and that left the biggest impression. Our group of three ordered the Chili Mac and the Cincinnati Throw Down Nachos.... 15 minutes later nachos without any [Cincinnati] chili on them, and no chili Mac arrived at all. Told staff that delivered the food, and the waitress returned and did a nice job of quickly writing down what was missing. Only the Chili Mac then arrived.  Normally we'd order the amazing Peach Kuchen to enjoy at home later but skipped it and hope for a better/normal experience next time.  If next time is at all better, I'll post an update and remove this one entirely.

5npbjwBOjPeVPkg_ybeokA.text: I had the chicken casserole with mac and cheese and green beans. It was excellent. The service was fast and atmosphere good. I just wish they had better parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. $7.95 Tuesday Special

oxAzmYNb0AD9OLnSt3LbOQ.text: My husband and I came here for an evening dinner date. Staff was friendly. Our waiter was super nice and fantastic when it came to helping us understand the different kinds of chili! My husband is a huge fan of chili so this was the place to go. For dinner my he ordered a bowl of chili, which came with a slice of cornbread, and also ordered a side of green beans. I ordered Nachos with chili on top. The nachos were a little bland for my taste. But next time, I'll be sure to try another item on their menu. My husbands chili tasted amazing. Thanks for the great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

UWwWKcSJ0NXCdo8n_0hNXQ.text: Funky, popular  dive with an eclectic following and Cincinnati-style spaghetti sauce.  There's a lot to like about this place from it's quirky interior to its hipster staff.  And at lunch it's almost always slammed.  Today we ordered the Friday Pork Roast with mac-n-cheese and green beans, plus a Texas burger with chili with chips.  The quick service and reasonable prices could not, unfortunately, overcome the just OK flavors.    Each time I visit a Lupie's I want the food to match the ambience,  but it typically falls flat for me.  I did think the mac-n-cheese was good and was the most flavor-filled item on the plate.   The green beans I cry foul, however . . . straight outta the can.  Many people rave about Lupie's, so "Give 'em a whirl" and see if you  become an ardent fan standing in line for a seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Friday special Roast Pork with choice of two sides, $7.95.
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZXhTWfGpPcp7-PkFyHPWvg.text: GOOD HOME COOKIN  I'll make this sweet and short....If you have to ask what's good here, this must be your first time... EVERYTHING is good here. My personal favorite without listing the whole menu, is the Wednesday & Friday Spaghetti.   Enjoy what you eat!  P.S. the corn bread is sooo good and the sweet tea!!

bI8CyQvmr8KQqwynVm8Fhw.text: Lupie's is great comfort food for when you are craving some. It's very standard American fare home cooking type of place with a few different types of chili. I love getting the chili and spaghetti with half Texas half southern. It is so good! They give you plenty of cheese, onions and sour cream. The corn bread isn't sweet- it's real cornbread. The meatloaf special with mashed potatoes and gravy is good for the price and hits the spot. Make sure to add some banana pudding to your order- yum!

HkqD2J2YQMTo9nJsyRCyFw.text: My mom loves this place. I just don't get it. Also it's very dirty. Now, if she wants to go, I just get a drink and sit with her while she eats.I have tried a few items but it is bland. I think the chili is what most people like, but I don't like chili with beans. Just meat.

hFIbzrox2ieZNk_gWKKJOA.text: Absolutely the best chili and slaw burger I've ever had!  They have four different chili's to pick from, and the texas red is not only delicious but HOT, just like it says on the menu, and try it on an onion roll, you won't regret it.  My wife has been coming here since the 90's and she said it's always been exactly the same as she remembers.  It's great to see a place that has a special style that doesn't change, because it makes it more of a destination than just another restaurant.  And you really can't beat the prices, you can get in and out for a little more than $10 each and that's including beers!  I'm so hooked on the chili burger, it's been the only thing I've had, except for dessert.  You have to try the kuchen, it is a simple and delicious fruit pie covered with whipped cream, fantastic.

ivwyobBIHGW13BTsJ2T38g.text: I have been a huge fan of Lupie's for years!! A retired police officer told me about this wonderful little place.  Since cops know doughnuts, they must know good food too!  The best thing about Lupie's is nothing is fried and they have home cooked daily specials. The chicken and dumplings, fettuccine Alfredo, quiche, vegetables, etc. are always a good choice.  My usual go to is the burger, chef salad or wings. It depends on my food mood, but I've never been disappointed in a dish here! The sweet tea is plentiful and if you're a beer person, you can enjoy a Gee Whiz for $1 (PBR...but hey, it's a buck!)  This trip, I ordered the BBQ wings. The meat was so tender it fell of the bone. I couldn't detect any seasoning in the meat itself, but the sauce was smoky and sweet. The ranch for dipping pairs very nicely and balances the overall flavor. It also is homemade, not a food service ranch product.   Desserts are also really tasty. The brownies and kuchen are my favorites.

FyHx6iJ8pgdb1r2DU664TQ.text: Let me start by saying that I really wanted to like this place. I did. I promise. This place has been on my bookmark page for quite a while. Today, since I was in the area, I decided to try it out. Although the tea was good, this place was not my cup of it.   Today I ordered the Lupie's chilli slaw burger with the mac and cheese as a side. I saw many pictures of the mac and cheese and thought it looked delicious. So for me this was a no-brainer. After tasting the burger, I must say that this was probably one of the blandest burgers I've had in a very long time. Perhaps, I've been spoiled by going to some of the top burger joints in town. But I did not enjoy my burger at all. Other than being bland, the bun tasted a bit off, the meat was not soft and juicy.   The mac and cheese looked as it looked in the pictures. Beautiful. After taking my first bite, I was highly disappointed. It tasted as if it was merely boiled noodles with cheese that was melted on top of it. It was not mixed in very well at all. Worst of all, it tasted bland as well. I added some salt and it helped a little bit, but I very rarely add extra salt to my meals.   The tea was delicious. Other than the service, it was the only thing I truly enjoyed. But since this isn't a tea shop, I can't base my meal off of the taste of the drink. Perhaps, I should have tried the nachos instead because they looked great (but then again, so did the mac and cheese).   All in all, I was disappointed in my meal today. I can at least say I got the opportunity to try Lupie's Cafe out today. I thank the staff for wonderful service but I will most likely not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

L07_ToFNtr3PFl667cY03A.text: I don't get to Lupie's often but when I do, it's always their fantastic Cincinnati Chili that I order.  Looking back, I believe I was at Lupie's when I first discovered Cincinnati Chili.

photos.caption: Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cincinnati Chili with cheese, onion, &amp; cornbread. It looked nice and pretty before I started digging into this deliciousness.

786j7fGdH8PMNbzdA5VbuA.text: Found this cute little hole-in-the-wall restaurant on a recent trip to Charlotte to get my jewelry kiln repaired by The Kiln Dr. Menu is a little limited but my husband and I enjoyed our lunch. Service was great and portions were generous. I had a yummy hot dog and husband got the wings (which were too hot for me but he said were GREAT!!). I can definitely see why it's a favorite of Charlotte diners.  Was going to take a pic of the food but dove into it as soon as it came and it was mostly gone before I remembered I had wanted to take photos LOL oh well next time  :)

Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lupie's Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

tDVFLcPPQVTxB05veRD5Iw.text: Finally got to eat at this apparent Charlotte institution my husband has not been able to keep quiet about and I'm glad I did. From what I saw everything on the menu was very reasonably priced, but you also get your money's worth with gargantuan portion sizes. I was quite full after eating half of my BBQ platter... which was very tasty, by the way.  The service was so-so. Our server seemed kind of rushed, but he wasn't bad. The Mac and Cheese here was pretty awesome. So many people try to do Mac and Cheese, and despite it being such a simple dish I've never had this side done as well as they did it as this restaurant.

WyOccTmwvUwTdaAOCOf50A.text: This is hands down probably one of my favorite restaurants of all time. I haven't  lived in Charlotte for twelve years but it remains one place I have to visit whenever I come visit.  The mac-and-cheese, the throw down nachos, the chili, and OMG, the squash. The wait staff is always awesome and the food usually comes pretty fast. There is a line quite often but it usually moves pretty fast.

pozcwFSfqoYqJ0q6AMDUsg.text: Awesome burgers! They are known for their amazing selection of chili. Never been a fan of chili and I'm still not, but there's just something about theirs that I can't get enough of! Try a burger with chili and coleslaw. You will thank me later. Service is excellent and the atmosphere is unique.

e6RJpSYEIyUKtZzRg7qBZA.text: Food was awesome and really unique. I had a Slaw/Chili Hamburger and it is was it sounds like a Cheeseburger with Cole Slaw and Chili on it. A little messy but really really good. Everybody talks about the Mac-n-Cheese from Lupie's and the only problem with this dish is that they don't serve it in a bathtub size container! This think was cheesier than any pizza I had.  For those of you not from the South, be warned that when you order tea it comes out as sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeet tea   Took back to my hotel room the Banana pudding and loved the amount of Nilla Wafers in it! The Bomb!!!  My only disappointment was the staff. My waiter was totally obnoxious to me and my hope was that he was just having a bad night.   I shall return!

IerDt0EOoSOcm3ILtUTWGw.text: Cool and Quirky:  It really doesn't get any realer than this. I feel "at home" when I go to Lupie's! Lupie's has a set of things they are good at, and they stick to it. You have to be in the mood for what they are serving, and it is always good to sync up with the menu. The menu has a different rotating set of things on it per day of week. There is always chili (three or four types) and chili mac on it tho. The vibe in there is always good, and the different types of chili really have been hitting the spot this winter.

b3P4SbZi8o816vnXah6oAQ.text: The meatloaf is amazing and full of flavor.. Sweet tea stays full and these people stay on top of it..  Comin back here again soon..

6B4KvEaTdnpo7cLd_1UMeQ.text: I loved this place. It has a very divey feel, but things still work the way they're supposed to. They take debit, they have free refills, they make me happy. I had a bacon cheeseburger and it was great. It tasted like I grilled it myself. I wasn't crazy about the deli-style mustard, but most people would love that stuff. I'm a French's yellow kind of guy.

0lMKscyNd4MzWr9fV8tTrA.text: Good Golly Miss Molly!!,! The food is awesome!! Ate there last nite and WOW...Home cooking is all you get. The Throw down nachos were great! Going back here for sure!!!

1qp9DA7wDxEz245Vn_UTtg.text: Lupie's Cafe is a quiet cozy hole in the wall with ecelctic decor and dim lighting.  The food is simple, homemade, and good.  My boyfriend and I decided to share a huge plate of nachos, topped with Texas chili, jalepenos, and a mountain full of cheese, with salsa and sour cream on the side.  The chili had a nice bite and with the additional condiments it was a delectable bite.  For dinner we shared the pulled pork and asparagus & crab quiche.  Both were sided with fresh fruit and veggies, all good.  To end the meal, we shared banana pudding (should've ordered 2 because it was so good),  The service was friendly and attentive, we'll definitely be back again.

xEHUnvTSGMADEwt7zd1LgA.text: Since I'm a NC native, I'm going to take a few liberties. Strike that. Since I'm a UNC grad, I'll take lots of liberties. For my fellow Tarheels, you'll know exactly what I mean.  Lupies is the He's Not Here of food in Charlotte. End of review.  Just kidding. I wouldn't respect myself in the morning if I let the metaphor slide by those of you not familiar with Chapel Hill.  He's Not Here is (or was- is it still there?) a watering hole familiar and dearly loved by undergraduates. The beer was cheap, the music was loud, and the crowd often raucous beyond belief. You'd go to He's Not Here to howl at the moon- or whatever. He's Not Here was not the most consistent place, sometimes your beer would be so hot-off-the-tap it would be... hot. The burgers and fries were good or not good- depending on the day, size of crowd or size of hangover the cook or you were nursing.   You'd go to He's Not Here for what it DID have- attitude, history, and a sense of place.  That's Lupie's in a nutshell. I've been to Lupie's and had a delicious burger. I've been to Lupie's and had a mediocre burger. The service, while not always stellar, has usually tended to the casual, if not pleasant. And yes, most times Lupie herself is somewhere near the register.  People like Lupie's because they know Lupie's. Not only that, they know Lupie, the owner who started this establishment over 20 years ago, when its location not only put it on the edge of the 'hood, it was IN the 'hood. Heck, by any standard, 20 years in the restaurant business is like being there at the signing of the Declaration of Independence.  So it is with Lupies. Don't go expecting much, and if you leave pleasantly surprised, which you probably will, you'll come back.  Note: I once heard Lupie's squash casserole mentioned on Jane and Michael Stern's Road Food segment on NPR. It's sort of like having the Jack Kerouac stamp of approval.

AXeS1DQX-vV3dNPl_ee7eg.text: I have wanted to try Lupie's for years and finally got the chance last week.  Yea I'm good now.  The wings with BBQ sauce were big and soft and seriously drenched in sauce, not the way I like my wings.  Chicken and dumplings were good but I just wasn't really feeling it.  Side of canned green beans, really canned??  And mac and cheese was okay.  Corn bread was not good, really dry and my sisters piece had hair in it.    They were out of 2 different chilis when we were there and so my sisters BF didn't eat because it was what he wanted, and we saw people walk out when told.  Prices were good and staff was friendly, but subpar food won't get me back anytime soon.

ZF4cTExA4WM7M4yOx4yaHA.text: This local place has character and good home-style cooking. Service can be hit or miss - I've had really outstanding servers at times and other times, not so great. However, the food is good, portions are generous, and prices are cheap, so I can overlook the occasional lapse in service. I am not a fan of their veggie burger or their vegetarian chili, but they normally have fresh & delish veggie plates - with super mac-n-cheese. I like their cornbread too. On Thursdays you can get home-style chicken & dumplings - which for a native southerner like me is True comfort food. Oh, and don't forget to save room for the banana pudding!

e2oQ7B2dcKwNktPmst0iXw.text: Lupie's has been a Charlotte staple for over 20 years! I love this place! Monday's special - meat loaf w/ mashed potatoes and green beans. Come on now, that's how you start off your week. They have a different special every day. I need to get over there on a Thursday night for the chicken & dumplings. Fantastic burgers too! I really like the chili burger. My wife's one requirement for a really good burger, "it needs to be running down your arm good". Lupie's has it. This place is a one of kind with character. The sweet tea is outstanding and served up in small jars. Nice touch. Oh, word to the wise, If you're OCD and need everything straight, I recommend sitting with your back the wall of photos. Every one of them is crooked. ha!

vtMmGTMREsn38gAJrME4Hw.text: We took our first trip up to Lupie's this past weekend before a concert at Bojangles Coliseum. We had heard about it and wanted to try it for ourselves. It was a great call! I had the chicken and dumplins and they were fantastic. Truly some of the best I've ever had and I only wish I could have finished the whole bowl. We also got an enormous plate of nachos which were served loaded with cheese, beans, and jalapenos along with bowls of sour cream and salsa.  There were plenty of bottled beer options from which to select. The waitress was friendly and attentive. It was a great experience and we will definitely be back.

mrI3U7LKPp8l5d89jeTz2A.text: I love this place and make a point to stop in whenever I'm in Charlotte.  The food is amazing. The atmosphere is amazing. The music is amazing. Gee-Whizz beer is amazing. The Chili is amazing. You get the point.  This place may not look like much from the outside (or it looks awesome depending on your definition) but inside is a chili joint that you'll fall in love with.  Lupie's focuses it's food around 3-4 unique types of chili (EVEN VEGETARIAN) that you can add to anything else on the menu (or have by itself).    I recommend the Chili Slaw Burger, loaded, with jalapenos and the Texan Chili.  WOW!!!! Get chips to scoop up what falls off!!!!

Zyh5GMKwZb2Es10X_tiijQ.text: Food was good!  We had chicken and dumplings, a burger, and the Cincinnati chili.  Servings were huge!  Service could have been friendlier, but it was efficient nonetheless.

J0Pd7BYUkTKUVIJsJeTtgQ.text: Let me start by saying: Lupie's makes the best chili on Earth.   They also have fantastic veggie plate, as well as burgers and meatloaf.  You can generally get out for under $12.  I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant.

ApOC-clV6-A8imldyuqn0g.text: Lupie's is THE must-eat at joint in Charlotte....period!  The mac 'n cheese is just fantabulous; you will not leave hungry!  Be sure to be nice to Lupie (she runs the place); what a first-class lady.

nWHKCVIwrz4SO7no1kVTLw.text: Every time I leave this place, I'm smiling giddily and grabbing my gut as I stumble back to the car. It's a happy feeling, but very intense, so we only hit Lupie's once or twice a month.   I've had everything veg-friendly on the menu (and whoops, a few things that weren't, which I'm sure I would have been told about, had I thought to ask) and it's all good, in that holy-crap-this-is-insane kinda way. If you're veg and ordering nachos, remember to get them with their veggie chili instead of beans-- yes, there's lard in them beans. Chili "salad" is hilarious and awesome, I've only had the restraint to order quiche here once, and found it simple but tasty. The same can be said for the mac n' cheese-- you can go elsewhere and find a more complex version, but I think the slight velveeta-ishness of Lupie's makes perfect sense and when I'm in the mood for it, it hits the spot every time.

ScPqeHpotmlARxp_S13IBQ.text: Oh man.. I've been coming to Lupie's since I was in elementary school. It's always crowded, but that gives it this awesome homey feel. It's got perfect tea served in mason jars, delicious chili, good sandwiches, fast service and the best mac&cheese money can buy. What more could you want?

k0ughX2kFQXvZ4Bp_4rb9g.text: Food is good.  I am a regular customer.  I come in today for takeout and for the first time ever the cook ask me if I want to leave a "tip for the kitchen".  WTF?  Aren't kitchen staff paid hourly unlike wait staff?  What a scam!  All he did was scoop up my food and put in a to go container and put it in a bag and ring me up and I had to tip him for that.  I'm sure he is pocketing all that extra money from other customers as well.  Shame I will not be back because of one bad seed.  I guess that banana pudding was worth $6.95 :-(

mKN-ULgmQuPMgm3Mb4qTpg.text: Not bad for a restaurant that serves only reheated leftovers and servers that ignore you.

vyOT9oVKLhoLndkvzSxwdA.text: Best dive in Charlotte? Lupie's...hands down.  Don't let the windowless brick building with the wind-weathered sign fool you - this place was making great food before you and will be here long after you're gone. It has that old-school diner grunge and big flavors from lots of practice.  Their specialty is chilli and it's off the chart. They have a wide variety to choose from that range from sweet to spicy, mild to "oh-my-god-I'm-dying"and you can get it in a bowl or piled on top of just about anything. The "home cooking" entrees, only one per day and it rotates, look like the perfect comfort food. Burgers are amazing and the portions on everything are heaping.  If you can fight your way into the parking lot, you are in for one of the best kept secrets in Charlotte!

j_sRRJ9pkDgqNInxoMJGBQ.text: I've been in Charlotte for over 13 years now and this was only my second visit ever to Lupie's. I think there's a lot of history here, it reminds of those cool, local places the natives take you when you're visiting their turf. Like those 90's hungouts where the cool kids hung out before or after shows. Either way, I don't know much about the history of Lupie's. The building is awesome, the front doors are probably as old as the building and the aging on the walls gives it a lot of appeal.   The staff was very friendly and serviceable.  My daughters ordered a burger and a BLT and both were very, pleased with their order. Girl #1 ordered just a regular burger and said it was one of the better burgers she's had recently. Oddly enough, Lupie's doesn't have a kid's menu. I don't think I've seen an eatery without a kid's menu in quite some time.  I ordered the nachos.... yeah, not the brightest idea. I wish the waitress would have give me a heads up about the size. To put it in perspective, you can feed half the population of Peru with a single order of nachos from Lupies. Half of my portion is still sitting in my refrigerator... crap, that reminds me, I gotta go throw them out now, they're several days old. The nachos were very, very standard. Cheese, beans, and jalapenos over chips. I could have made them at home and they would have been just as good,  The food is ok, nothing to write home about. I didn't particularly like it or dislike it. So, it's pretty safe to say that if I'm in the area again, I'll probably end up there.

YbQecqTHqijSII_8eZ9SIg.text: Best meatloaf around!  Good service. Make sure you try the banana pudding. To die for!  Different and relaxing atmosphere. Do not miss if you're looking for good home cooking.

PLpPscYDpACoacnSUEFBww.text: This review written by my 11yr old niece Emily - my comments at the end.   "Hello people this is my uncle's account thingy for yelp but he let me write a review for him so here is my review for the famed Lupie's! Well portions are great and so is the service and the food. Is  very reasonably priced. The only thing that I didn't really like was my desert kuchen it's way to sweet (but I almost ate the whole thing by myself). In all I had a great experience and I would recommend this restaurant. The end"  My account Pros - Great hole in the wall place to try North Carolina comfort food. Daily specials.  - Tried: Burger, Gumbo, BBQ wings, chicken with dumplings, throw down nachos, quiche, cobbler dessert (Kuchen?). - Desert was very tasty & sweet - my niece almost finished the whole thing by herself! - Great service - the servers were great. They even let us sample the 4 types of chili to help our final decision. - Rear parking - plenty of seating inside - nicely appointed w/comfortable setting.  Cons - Looks like it gets crowded here on weekdays. We stopped by on Sat (opens @ noon) - by the time we were leaving the back lot was full.  Return Visit - Yes - next time I'm in town.
